verses.roman:
jīva hañā kare yei tāhāra varṇana
āpanā śodhite tāra choṅye eka 'kaṇa'

synonyms: jīva hañā—being an ordinary living entity; kare—makes; yei—whoever; tāhāra—of that; varṇana—description; āpanā—himself; śodhite—to purify; tāra—of that; choṅye—touches; eka kaṇa—one particle.
translation: When an ordinary living entity describes the pastimes of Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu, he purifies himself by touching one drop of that great ocean.
